section.title: User Maintenance Module
section.para: As an administrator at a client company, you use the User Maintenance module to create, modify or delete user accounts at your company, define the permissions granted to those users, and reset user passwords.

section.title: Terminology
section.para: The term "account" is used in the sense it is normally used in software, to mean a user's registration with a system enabling him or her to log in - not in the everyday banking sense of a place to keep money.

section.title: Functions
section.para: The User Maintenance functions are part of the System Features menu. They are as follows:

listitem.para: Maintain user accounts. A user's account details are called his or her profile. You can create new accounts, update existing accounts, and delete existing accounts. You cannot delete your own account. A company's main default administrator account can only be deleted by the bank. When you create a new user account, you are then shown a link to set up the user's permissions.

Assign permissions to users. You do this by granting roles, which are sets of permissions. These permissions define which modules of the user can use, and what amount of money the user can submit transactions for when dealing with each bank.

Manage users' entities, by associating entities with users. A user's entities defines the scope of transactions that that user can access. It enables the company to attach users to departments or branches.

section.title: Profiles
section.para: Maintain user accounts. A user's account details are called his or her profile.

When you select this option, you are presented with a list of all the existing user accounts at your company. You can search the list by entering search criteria in the Last Name, First Name and Login fields at the top of the page.
The list of existing user accounts has the following columns:

entry.para: Field
Description
First Name and Last Name of the user.
Login Id used by the user to log into . This login Id uniquely identifies a user account within the company.

section.para:
You can modify an account by clicking the Edit
icon in the right-hand column, view it in non-editable mode by clicking the View
icon, or delete it by clicking the Delete
icon.

You cannot delete your own account. A company's main default administrator account admin can only be deleted by the bank. Therefore the entries for these accounts do not have the Delete
icon.
If a user that you delete has initiated some transaction events that are still pending, a new Save or Submit of these transactions needs to be done by an authorised user to re-activate them.

Click the Add
button at the bottom of the list to add an account.

section.title: Profiles Form
section.para: Edit and Add display the same form, but in the case of Add it is blank (except that the Company is set to your company) and in the case of Edit it is preset with the existing details of the user's account. After entering the details, click Save at the bottom of the form.

When you select this option, you are presented with a list of all the existing user accounts at your company. You can search the list by entering search criteria in the Last Name, First Name and Login fields at the top of the page.
The list of existing user accounts has the following columns:

You can modify a user's permissions by clicking the Edit

You cannot add or delete users via this list - you can only add or delete users by using the Profiles function.

section.para: Assign entities to users. These entities represent the parts of your company (for example, departments or branches) that the user is attached to.

When you select this option, you are presented with a list of all the existing user accounts at your company. You can search the list by entering search criteria in the Last Name, First Name and Login fields at the top of the page.

section.title: Authentication

note.para: Access to this module must be given with care, and only to the password administrator.
